metadata.Name: PRESTO
metadata.Description: A multilingual (English, German) dataset for parsing task-oriented dialogs. It features realistic, complex conversations from an in-car assistant domain, collected via a Wizard-of-Oz setup. It includes semantic annotations for intent and arguments.
metadata.Paper Title: PRESTO: A Multilingual Dataset for Parsing Realistic Task-Oriented Dialogs
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2021 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Venue Name: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Abstract: Existing datasets for task-oriented dialogs are dominated by simplistic, slot-filling style conversations that do not reflect the complexity of real-world scenarios. In this paper, we introduce PRESTO, a new publicly available dataset of over 4,400 realistic, multilingual (English and German) task-oriented dialogs that go beyond the standard slot-filling paradigm. PRESTO was collected via a novel Wizard-of-Oz (WoZ) data collection methodology that encourages agents to produce more complex and varied conversational flows. The dataset features complex phenomena such as additions and removals of items from a list, context switches, and interruptions. We provide a detailed analysis of the dataset and benchmark a state-of-the-art dialog state tracking model on PRESTO, showing that it struggles with the complexity of the dataset. We hope that PRESTO will serve as a challenging testbed for future research in task-oriented dialog.
